triples.name: Spontaneous symmetry breaking
triples.relevance: Fundamental concept underlying the phase transitions and ordered states demonstrated in the experiment.

triples.name: Symmetry breaking
triples.relevance: Core theoretical framework for understanding the classification of phases of matter in the system.

triples.name: Phase transition
triples.relevance: Describes the transitions between different ordered phases observed in the XY ferromagnet and antiferromagnet.

triples.name: Goldstone boson
triples.relevance: Gapless Goldstone modes emerge from continuous symmetry breaking and control thermodynamic stability of the ordered phase.

triples.name: Classical XY model
triples.relevance: Paper realizes a two-dimensional dipolar XY model experimentally, advancing the understanding of XY interactions.

triples.name: Rydberg atom
triples.relevance: Rydberg atoms form the basis of the programmable quantum simulator used to realize the XY model.

triples.name: Quantum simulator
triples.relevance: Paper demonstrates a Rydberg quantum simulator for realizing the dipolar XY model and studying many-body physics.

triples.name: Ferromagnetism
triples.relevance: XY ferromagnetism is one of the two phases studied, characterized by long-range order and dipolar interactions.

triples.name: Antiferromagnetism
triples.relevance: XY antiferromagnet is the complementary phase studied, showing alternating spin orientation patterns.

triples.name: Ising model
triples.relevance: Contrasts with the XY model; paper notes previous Rydberg work realized Ising-type interactions showing discrete spin symmetry.

triples.name: Magnetic dipole
triples.relevance: Long-range dipolar interactions are essential for the XY model realization and enable features prohibited without them.

triples.name: Quantum phase transition
triples.relevance: Adiabatic preparation explores transitions between different quantum phases of the XY model.
